summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 regarding correspondence from Arlan Ettinger of Guernsey's Auctioneers & Brokers about the property of the late Jeffrey Epstein. The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) viewed it as an unsolicited vendor advertisement and did not respond.

persons.name: Arlan Ettinger
persons.context: He is the sender of the original correspondence regarding the property of Jeffrey Epstein, which was forwarded to the USAO-SDNY for handling.

persons.name: Nathaniel Gamble II
persons.role: Official from the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG)
persons.context: He advised that the correspondence from Arlan Ettinger be assigned to the USAO-SDNY for handling.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased individual whose property is the subject of the correspondence
persons.context: The late Jeffrey Epstein's property is the subject of the auction house inquiry forwarded to the Department of Justice.

connections.description: Ettinger, as an auction house president, was inquiring about Epstein's property, indicating a potential commercial interest in handling its sale.
Gamble directed Ettinger's correspondence to the USAO-SDNY, establishing an administrative/professional link regarding the handling of Epstein's estate.

events.title: DOJ Declines Response to Auction House Inquiry
events.description: A DOJ official confirms that correspondence from Arlan Ettinger regarding Jeffrey Epstein's property was viewed as an unsolicited vendor ad and no response was required or given.

events.title: Auction House Inquiry Forwarded to USAO-SDNY
events.description: Correspondence from Arlan Ettinger of Guernsey's Auctioneers regarding Epstein's property is forwarded to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for handling, as advised by Nathaniel Gamble II.

keyFacts: Arlan Ettinger, President of Guernsey's Auctioneers & Brokers, contacted the DOJ regarding the property of the late Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence was assigned to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) for handling.
The USAO-SDNY viewed the inquiry as an unsolicited vendor advertisement and chose not to respond.
The email chain shows the DOJ's internal process for handling external inquiries related to the Epstein estate in early 2020.
